diamonds.title: Round Brilliant Diamond
diamonds.desc: Maximum fire and brilliance with ideal symmetry.
diamonds.longDesc: Round brilliant diamonds are the most precisely engineered cut, designed to maximize light return and sparkle. With perfectly balanced proportions and unmatched brilliance, they remain the most sought-after choice for fine jewellery and long-term gemstone investment.

diamonds.title: Oval Cut Diamond
diamonds.desc: Elegant elongated brilliance with a slimming appearance.
diamonds.longDesc: Oval cut diamonds combine the sparkle of a round brilliant with a graceful elongated silhouette. This cut offers excellent brilliance while appearing larger per carat, making it ideal for elegant engagement rings and modern luxury jewellery.

diamonds.title: Cushion Cut Diamond
diamonds.desc: Soft pillow shape with vintage-inspired sparkle.
diamonds.longDesc: Cushion cut diamonds feature rounded corners and larger facets that enhance fire and brilliance. Known for their romantic appeal, they are highly valued in vintage-style and bespoke luxury jewellery designs.

diamonds.title: Emerald Cut Diamond
diamonds.desc: Clean step facets showcasing crystal clarity.
diamonds.longDesc: Emerald cut diamonds are admired for their elegant step facets and refined hall-of-mirrors effect. This cut emphasizes clarity and symmetry, making it a favorite among collectors and connoisseurs of understated luxury.

diamonds.title: Asscher Cut Diamond
diamonds.desc: Art deco geometry with deep visual depth.
diamonds.longDesc: Asscher cut diamonds feature a square shape with cropped corners and deep step facets, creating a bold, architectural look. Popular during the Art Deco era, this cut highlights clarity and symmetry with a distinctive vintage character.

diamonds.title: Princess Cut Diamond
diamonds.desc: Modern brilliance with sharp square symmetry.
diamonds.longDesc: Princess cut diamonds are renowned for their contemporary appeal and strong brilliance. With sharp angles and excellent light performance, they are a top choice for modern engagement rings and luxury statement jewellery.

diamonds.title: Pear Cut Diamond
diamonds.longDesc: Pear shaped diamonds combine the round and marquise cuts to create a unique silhouette. This elegant shape offers excellent brilliance and a flattering elongated appearance, ideal for pendants and distinctive rings.

diamonds.title: Marquise Cut Diamond
diamonds.desc: Elongated shape that maximizes visual size.
diamonds.longDesc: Marquise cut diamonds feature a long, narrow shape with pointed ends, designed to maximize perceived size. This cut delivers bold brilliance and dramatic presence, making it a preferred choice for statement jewellery.

diamonds.title: Radiant Cut Diamond
diamonds.desc: Intense sparkle with durable trimmed corners.
diamonds.longDesc: Radiant cut diamonds combine brilliant and step facets to deliver exceptional fire while maintaining strong corner durability. This versatile cut is ideal for high-end rings and luxury custom jewellery.

diamonds.title: Fancy Yellow Diamond
diamonds.desc: Vivid yellow brilliance with warm saturation.
diamonds.longDesc: Fancy yellow diamonds are prized for their rich golden hues and radiant sparkle. Cushion cuts enhance color intensity, making these diamonds highly desirable for collectors and luxury colour gemstone jewellery.

diamonds.title: Champagne Diamond
diamonds.desc: Warm brown tones with refined elegance.
diamonds.longDesc: Champagne diamonds feature natural brown hues ranging from light honey to deep cognac. Their warm tones and subtle sparkle make them a sophisticated choice for modern luxury and bespoke jewellery designs.

sapphires.title: Cornflower Blue Sapphire
sapphires.desc: Soft velvety blue with exceptional transparency.
sapphires.longDesc: Cornflower blue sapphires are among the most prized gemstones in the world, known for their perfectly balanced blue hue with a soft, velvety glow. Originating from Sri Lanka, these sapphires are highly sought after by collectors and luxury jewellery houses for their rarity, natural brilliance and investment-grade value.

sapphires.title: Royal Blue Sapphire
sapphires.desc: Deep saturated blue with commanding presence.
sapphires.longDesc: Royal blue sapphires display a rich, intense blue colour associated with luxury and prestige. Sourced from Sri Lanka, these stones offer excellent brilliance and depth, making them ideal for high-end rings, necklaces and heirloom jewellery pieces.

sapphires.title: Deep Blue Sapphire
sapphires.desc: Bold deep blue tone with strong brilliance.
sapphires.longDesc: Deep blue sapphires from Madagascar are valued for their vivid saturation and excellent clarity. These stones exhibit strong brilliance under light and are widely used in contemporary fine jewellery and gemstone investment portfolios.

sapphires.title: Kashmir Blue Sapphire
sapphires.desc: Legendary velvety blue with unmatched rarity.
sapphires.longDesc: Kashmir blue sapphires are considered the pinnacle of sapphire quality. Known for their velvety, almost glowing blue colour, these stones are exceptionally rare and highly valued by elite collectors and auction houses worldwide.

sapphires.title: Pear Cut Blue Sapphire
sapphires.desc: Elegant pear shape with graceful brilliance.
sapphires.longDesc: Pear cut blue sapphires combine round and marquise brilliance into a refined teardrop silhouette. Sri Lankan origin ensures excellent colour balance and clarity, making these stones ideal for statement pendants and luxury rings.

sapphires.title: Pink Sapphire
sapphires.desc: Vibrant pink tone with lively sparkle.
sapphires.longDesc: Pink sapphires are admired for their romantic appeal and vibrant colour. African pink sapphires offer excellent brilliance and durability, making them a popular alternative to pink diamonds in fine jewellery.

sapphires.title: Purple Sapphire
sapphires.desc: Rich violet tones with elegant depth.
sapphires.longDesc: Purple sapphires from Madagascar display captivating violet hues with excellent transparency. These stones are increasingly popular among designers seeking unique colour gemstones for bespoke jewellery.

sapphires.title: Lavender Sapphire
sapphires.desc: Soft pastel tones with subtle brilliance.
sapphires.longDesc: Lavender sapphires offer a delicate and soothing colour palette. Their pastel hues and natural durability make them perfect for elegant jewellery pieces and collectors looking for rare colour variations.

sapphires.title: Padparadscha Sapphire
sapphires.desc: Rare pink-orange blend with lotus hue.
sapphires.longDesc: Padparadscha sapphires are among the rarest sapphires in the world, displaying a delicate balance of pink and orange hues. Originating from Sri Lanka, these gemstones are highly prized by collectors and investors.

sapphires.title: Parti Color Sapphire
sapphires.desc: Distinct dual tones in a single gemstone.
sapphires.longDesc: Parti sapphires exhibit natural zoning of blue and green colours within the same stone. Australian origin stones are especially valued for their unique appearance and individuality.

sapphires.title: Orange Sapphire
sapphires.desc: Bright orange hue with lively fire.
sapphires.longDesc: Orange sapphires are vibrant and energetic gemstones, offering excellent brilliance and durability. African orange sapphires are increasingly used in modern luxury jewellery designs.

sapphires.title: Yellow Sapphire
sapphires.desc: Bright golden yellow with strong clarity.
sapphires.longDesc: Yellow sapphires, also known as Pukhraj, are valued for their vivid golden colour and astrological significance. Sri Lankan stones are especially prized for their brightness and purity.

sapphires.title: Green Sapphire
sapphires.desc: Natural green tones with earthy elegance.
sapphires.longDesc: Green sapphires offer a refined alternative to emeralds, with excellent durability and unique colour. African green sapphires are ideal for contemporary jewellery collections.

sapphires.title: Emerald Cut Green Sapphire
sapphires.desc: Step cut clarity with refined green tone.
sapphires.longDesc: Emerald cut green sapphires emphasize clarity and structure through clean step facets. Zambian stones are admired for their deep colour and gemstone durability.

sapphires.title: Teal Sapphire
sapphires.desc: Blue-green blend with modern appeal.
sapphires.longDesc: Teal sapphires from Madagascar display a striking mix of blue and green tones. These stones are highly popular in modern jewellery due to their versatility and unique colour.

sapphires.title: Teal Sapphire Radiant
sapphires.desc: Radiant cut with vivid teal brilliance.
sapphires.longDesc: Radiant cut teal sapphires combine strong brilliance with durable faceting. Madagascan origin stones are favored for their colour stability and gemstone quality.

sapphires.title: White Sapphire
sapphires.desc: Colorless brilliance with natural durability.
sapphires.longDesc: White sapphires offer a diamond-like appearance with excellent hardness and clarity. Sri Lankan white sapphires are popular for both fine jewellery and astrological use.

sapphires.title: Star Blue Sapphire
sapphires.desc: Natural star effect with mystical appeal.
sapphires.longDesc: Star sapphires display a rare asterism effect caused by natural inclusions. Sri Lankan star sapphires are highly valued for their sharp star formation and spiritual significance.

sapphires.title: Cabochon Sapphire
sapphires.desc: Smooth polished surface with rich colour.
sapphires.longDesc: Cabochon sapphires emphasize colour over brilliance, offering a classic and traditional gemstone style. Sri Lankan cabochon sapphires are commonly used in bespoke and heritage jewellery.

sapphires.title: Emerald Cut Blue Sapphire
sapphires.desc: Deep navy blue with step-cut elegance.
sapphires.longDesc: Emerald cut navy blue sapphires highlight clarity and depth through structured step facets. Madagascan stones are appreciated for their rich colour and refined appearance.

rubies.title: Pigeon Blood Ruby
rubies.desc: Intense vivid red with legendary saturation.
rubies.longDesc: Pigeon Blood rubies represent the highest grade of natural ruby, known for their vivid red colour with a slight bluish undertone. Originating from Myanmar, these rubies are exceptionally rare and highly prized by collectors, investors, and luxury jewellery houses worldwide.

rubies.title: Burmese Ruby
rubies.longDesc: Burmese rubies are globally renowned for their rich red colour and superior crystal quality. Cushion-cut Burmese rubies showcase exceptional depth, natural glow, and timeless elegance, making them a cornerstone of fine ruby collections.

rubies.title: Burmese Round Ruby
rubies.desc: Balanced round brilliance with classic red tone.
rubies.longDesc: Round cut Burmese rubies deliver uniform brilliance and symmetry while retaining the rich red colour Myanmar rubies are famous for. These stones are ideal for high-end rings, pendants, and heritage jewellery.

rubies.title: Mozambique Ruby
rubies.desc: Bright red hue with excellent clarity.
rubies.longDesc: Mozambique rubies are admired for their bright red colour and impressive clarity. Cushion cut stones from this origin provide strong brilliance and durability, making them popular in modern luxury jewellery designs.

rubies.title: Madagascar Ruby
rubies.desc: Elegant oval ruby with balanced red tone.
rubies.longDesc: Madagascar rubies offer attractive red hues with good transparency and brilliance. Oval cuts enhance their visual size and elegance, making them suitable for refined jewellery and collector pieces.

rubies.title: Heated Ruby
rubies.longDesc: Heated rubies undergo traditional heat treatment to improve colour and clarity. These stones retain natural ruby characteristics while offering improved visual appeal, making them a popular choice for fine jewellery.

rubies.title: Untreated Ruby
rubies.desc: Completely natural ruby with untouched beauty.
rubies.longDesc: Untreated rubies are highly valued for their natural colour and authenticity. Myanmar-origin untreated rubies are especially rare, appealing to collectors who prioritize purity and geological integrity.

rubies.title: Pear Cut Ruby
rubies.desc: Graceful pear shape with soft red tones.
rubies.longDesc: Pear cut rubies combine brilliance and elegance in a teardrop silhouette. Pinkish red African rubies offer a softer romantic hue, ideal for bespoke pendants and statement jewellery.

rubies.title: Emerald Cut Ruby
rubies.desc: Structured step cut highlighting deep colour.
rubies.longDesc: Emerald cut rubies emphasize clarity and colour depth through clean step facets. Thai rubies in this cut offer a refined, architectural appearance favored in luxury and collector jewellery.

rubies.title: Marquise Ruby
rubies.longDesc: Marquise rubies provide excellent face-up size and dramatic appearance. African marquise cut rubies are chosen for bold jewellery designs and visually striking luxury pieces.

rubies.title: Heart Cut Ruby
rubies.desc: Romantic heart shape with vivid red glow.
rubies.longDesc: Heart cut rubies symbolize passion and love. These rare fancy cuts are carefully crafted to preserve symmetry and brilliance, making them ideal for bespoke and commemorative jewellery.

rubies.title: Star Ruby
rubies.desc: Natural star effect with mystical charm.
rubies.longDesc: Star rubies exhibit a rare asterism phenomenon caused by natural inclusions. Sri Lankan star rubies are prized for their sharp star formation and are often associated with spiritual and astrological significance.

emeralds.title: Colombian Emerald
emeralds.desc: World-famous deep green emerald with rich saturation.
emeralds.longDesc: Colombian emeralds are regarded as the finest in the world, prized for their intense deep green colour and exceptional transparency. Emerald-cut Colombian stones are highly sought after by collectors, luxury jewellers, and investment buyers.

emeralds.title: Zambian Emerald
emeralds.desc: Cool bluish green tone with excellent clarity.
emeralds.longDesc: Zambian emeralds are known for their slightly bluish green hue and superior crystal structure. Oval cuts enhance brilliance and face-up size, making them popular in premium modern jewellery designs.

emeralds.title: Brazilian Emerald
emeralds.desc: Soft green cushion cut with elegant brilliance.
emeralds.longDesc: Brazilian emeralds display lighter green tones with pleasing transparency. Cushion cuts add vintage charm while maintaining durability, ideal for statement rings and bespoke jewellery creations.

emeralds.title: Pear Cut Emerald
emeralds.desc: Elegant pear silhouette with graceful brilliance.
emeralds.longDesc: Pear cut emeralds combine rounded brilliance with tapered elegance. Zambian origin ensures stable colour and durability, making them ideal for pendants and high-end jewellery designs.

emeralds.title: Round Emerald
emeralds.desc: Symmetrical round cut with vibrant green glow.
emeralds.longDesc: Round emeralds maximize sparkle while preserving colour richness. Brazilian round emeralds are selected for uniform brilliance and are frequently used in modern engagement and fashion jewellery.

emeralds.title: Cabochon Emerald
emeralds.desc: Smooth polished surface showcasing natural colour.
emeralds.longDesc: Cabochon emeralds emphasize natural colour and body tone rather than brilliance. Colombian cabochons are highly valued for spiritual, astrological, and heritage jewellery applications.

emeralds.title: Vintage Emerald Cut Emerald
emeralds.longDesc: Vintage emerald cuts showcase wide step facets and elegant proportions. Colombian origin ensures superior colour quality, making these stones ideal for collectors of antique-style luxury jewellery.

emeralds.title: Light Green Emerald
emeralds.desc: Affordable emerald with soft green tone.
emeralds.longDesc: Light green African emeralds provide an accessible option for gemstone jewellery while maintaining natural emerald character. Oval cuts enhance size appearance and wearable elegance.

emeralds.title: Deep Green Emerald
emeralds.desc: Rich forest green with strong saturation.
emeralds.longDesc: Premium Zambian emeralds are admired for their intense forest-green colour and durability. Cushion cuts balance brilliance and structural strength, ideal for high-value fine jewellery.

emeralds.title: Investment Grade Emerald
emeralds.longDesc: Investment grade Colombian emeralds represent the highest quality category, selected for exceptional colour, clarity, and crystal structure. These stones are suitable for wealth preservation, high-end collectors, and elite jewellery houses.
